subprocess_flow.description: Introduce a diverse range of bacteria and archaea into the aquatic and terrestrial environments. These microorganisms will serve as the foundation for nutrient cycling and decomposition, essential for establishing a self-sustaining ecosystem. The selection will prioritize species known for their resilience and adaptability to varying environmental conditions.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To establish the foundational microbial life necessary for nutrient cycling and decomposition.
subprocess_flow.scope: Introduction of bacteria and archaea into the world's ecosystems.
end_conditions: Microbial populations are established and actively cycling nutrients

step_risks_and_controls.control: Introduce a balanced variety of species

subprocess_flow.description: Introduce various species of algae and phytoplankton into the aquatic environments. These photosynthetic organisms will form the base of the food chain, converting sunlight and nutrients into energy. The selection will include species capable of thriving in different light and nutrient conditions to ensure a stable primary production base.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To establish the primary producers that will form the base of the food chain.
subprocess_flow.scope: Introduction of algae and phytoplankton into the world's aquatic ecosystems.
end_conditions: Algal populations are established and actively producing energy

step_risks_and_controls.control: Introduce a diverse range of algal species

subprocess_flow.description: Initiate the evolutionary algorithm to simulate the processes of natural selection and adaptation. This algorithm will govern the development and diversification of life forms over time, allowing them to respond to environmental pressures and opportunities. The algorithm will be designed to promote biodiversity and resilience within the ecosystems.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To simulate evolutionary processes that drive the diversification and adaptation of life forms.
subprocess_flow.scope: Simulation of evolutionary processes within the world's ecosystems.
end_conditions: Evolutionary algorithm is running and actively simulating evolutionary processes

subprocess_flow.description: Establish basic food chains and nutrient cycles by introducing simple consumer organisms, such as protozoa and zooplankton, into the aquatic environments. These organisms will feed on the algae and bacteria, creating a flow of energy and nutrients through the ecosystem. The selection will prioritize species that can efficiently convert primary production into biomass.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To establish the basic food chains and nutrient cycles that will sustain the ecosystem.
subprocess_flow.scope: Introduction of simple consumer organisms into the world's aquatic ecosystems.
end_conditions: Food chains are established and actively cycling nutrients

step_risks_and_controls.control: Implement redundancy in species and resource distribution
